name: theory cocoon cardigan
notes:
transform your crochet skills into a cozy wardrobe staple with our crochet cocoon cardigan pdf pattern. crafted with ease and designed for comfort, this versatile cardigan is perfect for lounging at home or layering up for a stylish outing.

**pattern features:**
adult sizes xs to 5xl (30-62" chest): ensure the perfect fit for every body type.
skill level: easy
stitch: corner to corner
features comfy knit-look ribbing on the neckline and sleeves
instant digital download pdf pattern
full video tutorial (to support written pattern if you are a visual learner)
us crochet terms
uk stitch conversion chart

**why you'll love this pattern:**
easy to wear style: your crochet blanket cardigan will work with anything you own!
quick to make: the simple square for the cardigan body is just seamed at the sleeves and you have a shrug!
no shaping to worry about: with the emphasis on drape and ease, there’s no tricky increasing or decreasing to work.
detailed instructions: 11-page pdf in us crochet terms for clear, easy-to-follow guidance. all supported by a video tutorial too.

**materials needed:**
category 4 (dk/light worsted) yarn (i used color theory, 100% acrylic, with 246yds/100g)
crochet hook 5mm (h) or the size that meets the gauge for the pattern.
yarn needle
scissors
2 stitch markers

**pattern includes:**
detailed instructions over 11 page ebook
stitch guide
sizing chart/schematic
bonus stitch tutorial
colour inspiration page
full video tutorial


**instant download:** start crocheting your own unique cocoon cardigan today! purchase includes immediate access to the 11-page pdf pattern in us crochet terms.

**gauge:** 
5 rows of lace dc c2c pattern = 4” square.

this pattern is perfect for crocheters of all levels who want to create a beautiful and comfortable cocoon cardigan. whether you're treating yourself or making a heartfelt gift for a loved one, this pattern is sure to delight.

**need help?**
we're here for you! contact us anytime for pattern support or questions.
